bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Robert C. Gooch, February 16, 1942

div1.p: Hench requests information on Cuban medical bulletins that were missing when Hench visited the Library of Congress.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Robert C. Gooch, February 16, 1942
div1.opener:
Y. F.
February 16, 1942
Mr. Robert C. Gooch
Chief of the Book Services
Library of Congress
Washington, D. C.
My dear Mr. Gooch:
div1.p:
About three weeks ago I came into the Congressional
Library expecting to see the various numbers of the Boletin
Clinico Mensual del Hospital Numero Uno, which you had and
about which we had some correspondence last year. You
referred me to Mr. M. C. Leikind. Unfortunately, he was
unable to find them. I wonder if they have since turned up.
Mr. Leikind thought I could borrow them as an interlibrary
loan through the Mayo Clinic Library. He said they were
small pamphlets and could be sent with very little trouble.
I sincerely hope that you will keep on looking for them.
div1.closer: Very truly yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
